00516 
00518 #define LESENSE_CORECTRL_DESC_DEFAULT                                                               \
00519 {                                                                                                   \
00520   lesenseScanStartPeriodic,  /* Start new scan each time the period counter overflows. */           \
00521   lesensePRSCh0,             /* Default PRS channel is selected. */                                 \
00522   lesenseScanConfDirMap,     /* Direct mapping SCANCONF register usage strategy. */                 \
00523   false,                     /* Don't invert ACMP0 output. */                                       \
00524   false,                     /* Don't invert ACMP1 output. */                                       \
00525   false,                     /* Disable dual sampling. */                                           \
00526   true,                      /* Store scan result after each scan. */                               \
00527   true,                      /* Overwrite result buffer register even if it is full. */             \
00528   lesenseBufTrigHalf,        /* Trigger interrupt and DMA request if result buffer is half full. */ \
00529   lesenseDMAWakeUpDisable,   /* Don't wake up on DMA from EM2. */                                   \
00530   lesenseBiasModeDontTouch,  /* Don't touch bias configuration. */                                  \
00531   true                       /* Keep LESENSE running in debug mode. */                              \
00532 }
00533

00780 typedef struct
00781 {
00783   LESENSE_ChDesc_TypeDef Ch[16];
00784 } LESENSE_ChAll_TypeDef;
00785 
00787 #define LESENSE_CH_CONF_DEFAULT                                                                     \
00788 {                                                                                                   \
00789   true,                  /* Enable scan channel. */                                                 \
00790   true,                  /* Enable the assigned pin on scan channel. */                             \
00791   true,                  /* Enable interrupts on channel. */                                        \
00792   lesenseChPinExHigh,    /* Channel pin is high during the excitation period. */                    \
00793   lesenseChPinIdleLow,   /* Channel pin is low during the idle period. */                           \
00794   false,                 /* Don't use alternate excitation pins for excitation. */                  \
00795   false,                 /* Disabled to shift results from this channel to the decoder register. */ \
00796   false,                 /* Disabled to invert the scan result bit. */                              \
00797   false,                 /* Disabled to store counter value in the result buffer. */                \
00798   lesenseClkLF,          /* Use the LF clock for excitation timing. */                              \
00799   lesenseClkLF,          /* Use the LF clock for sample timing. */                                  \
00800   0x03U,                 /* Excitation time is set to 3(+1) excitation clock cycles. */             \
00801   0x09U,                 /* Sample delay is set to 9(+1) sample clock cycles. */                    \
00802   0x06U,                 /* Measure delay is set to 6 excitation clock cycles.*/                    \
00803   0x00U,                 /* ACMP threshold has been set to 0. */                                    \
00804   lesenseSampleModeACMP, /* ACMP output will be used in comparison. */                              \
00805   lesenseSetIntNone,     /* No interrupt is generated by the channel. */                            \
00806   0xFFU,                 /* Counter threshold has bee set to 0xFF. */                               \
00807   lesenseCompModeLess    /* Compare mode has been set to trigger interrupt on "less". */            \
00808 }
00809

00937 #define LESENSE_ST_CONF_DEFAULT                                        \
00938 {                                                                      \
00939   0x0FU,               /* Compare value set to 0x0F. */                \

00952   bool                      chainDesc;
00953 
00956   LESENSE_DecStCond_TypeDef confA;
00957 
00960   LESENSE_DecStCond_TypeDef confB;
00961 } LESENSE_DecStDesc_TypeDef;
00962 
00963 
00965 typedef struct
00966 {
00968   LESENSE_DecStDesc_TypeDef St[16];
00969 } LESENSE_DecStAll_TypeDef;

00973 {  /* chain |   Descriptor A         |   Descriptor B   */                               \
00974   {                                                                                      \
00975     { false, LESENSE_ST_CONF_DEFAULT, LESENSE_ST_CONF_DEFAULT }, /* Decoder state 0. */  \

01038 /***************************************************************************/
01046 __STATIC_INLINE void LESENSE_DecoderStop(void)
01047 {
01048   /* Stop the decoder */
01049   LESENSE->DECCTRL |= LESENSE_DECCTRL_DISABLE;
01050 }

01068 {

01070 }

01073 /***************************************************************************/
01093 __STATIC_INLINE void LESENSE_StatusWait(uint32_t flag)
01094 {
01095   while (!(LESENSE->STATUS & flag))
01096     ;
01097 }

01165 __STATIC_INLINE uint32_t LESENSE_ScanResultDataBufferGet(uint32_t idx)
01166 {
01167   /* Note: masking is needed to avoid over-indexing! */
01168   return LESENSE->BUF[idx & 0x0FU].DATA;
01169 }

01219 /***************************************************************************/
01228 __STATIC_INLINE void LESENSE_IntEnable(uint32_t flags)
01229 {
01230   LESENSE->IEN |= flags;
01231 }
01232 
01233 
01234 /***************************************************************************/
01243 __STATIC_INLINE void LESENSE_IntDisable(uint32_t flags)
01244 {
01245   LESENSE->IEN &= ~flags;
01246 }

01264 /***************************************************************************/
01275 __STATIC_INLINE uint32_t LESENSE_IntGet(void)
01276 {
01277   return LESENSE->IF;
01278 }
01279 
01280 
01281 /***************************************************************************/
01299 __STATIC_INLINE uint32_t LESENSE_IntGetEnabled(void)
01300 {
01301   uint32_t tmp;
01302 
01303   /* Store LESENSE->IEN in temporary variable in order to define explicit order
01304    * of volatile accesses. */
01305   tmp = LESENSE->IEN;
01306 
01307   /* Bitwise AND of pending and enabled interrupts */
01308   return LESENSE->IF & tmp;
01309 }
